short: Whether new tab is active after entering hint while holding Shift
description: Controls whether a new tab opened via hint activation with Shift modifier key will be the active (focused) tab. When enabled (true), holding Shift while activating a hint opens the target link in a new background (non-active) tab, allowing you to continue using the current tab without focus switching. When disabled (false, default), holding Shift opens the link in a new active tab that immediately receives focus.
valueDescription: Boolean flag to control whether hint activation with Shift opens new tab as non-active (true) or active (false)

values.description: Default value; holding Shift while activating a hint opens link in new active (focused) tab
When enabled, holding Shift while activating a hint opens link in new non-active (background) tab; mouseEventModifiers.shiftKey is set to false to prevent active tab switching
values.source: src/content_scripts/common/hints.js:389-391 - Read in hint activation handler to control tab focus behavior on Shift+hint activation

operations.context: Initialized as false in runtime.conf object
Checked when Shift key is pressed during hint activation; if true, opens new tab in background (non-active); sets mouseEventModifiers.shiftKey to false to prevent active tab switching

example.description: Enable opening new tabs in background when using Shift+hint activation

notes: This is a boolean setting that modifies hint behavior when the Shift modifier key is pressed. The default value (false) follows standard browser conventions where Shift+click opens a new active tab. When set to true, this setting provides an alternative workflow where Shift+hint activation opens the target in a background tab, allowing uninterrupted continued browsing on the current page. This is useful for users who prefer to batch-open multiple links without context-switching to each new tab. The setting only affects behavior when using hints with the Shift modifier; regular hint activation (without Shift) is not affected.
